summary: Mindmap feature testing completed successfully. All 5 backend RPC tests passed (mindmap.get, mindmap.generate, mindmap.set_importance with validation). Frontend verification confirmed all UI components working: sidebar nav, page header with subtitle, graph canvas with force-directed layout, legend bar with 7 category colors, toolbar with counts/timestamp/regenerate button, and node detail panel with importance controls.
passed_tests: Backend: mindmap.get returns cached data with nodes and edges
Backend: mindmap.generate creates new mindmap with LLM (9 topics + 5 people nodes)
Backend: mindmap.set_importance validates importance level (rejects invalid)
Backend: mindmap.set_importance requires node_id and importance params
Frontend: Sidebar nav item 'Mindmap' with Network icon visible and links to /admin/mindmap
Frontend: Page header shows 'Mindmap' and subtitle 'Your cognitive landscape'
Frontend: Toolbar shows topic/people counts (9 topics - 5 people), timestamp, Regenerate button
Frontend: Legend bar shows all 7 category colors (work, personal, urgent, planning, communication, learning, person)
Frontend: Graph canvas renders with react-force-graph-2d force-directed layout
Frontend: Topic nodes (blue) and Person nodes (gray) render correctly with labels
Frontend: High importance nodes show red ring indicator
Frontend: Node click opens detail sidebar with label, type badge, category, summary
Frontend: Importance buttons (high/medium/low) visible for topic nodes and clickable
Frontend: Regenerate button visible and accessible
seed_data_creation: Existing seeded data used: 5 memories, 5 people, 6 chat messages. Cached mindmap with 14 nodes (9 topics + 5 people) and 11 edges.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Mindmap feature fully tested. Backend RPC methods (mindmap.get, mindmap.generate, mindmap.set_importance) work via WebSocket at /api/gateway with 'connect' auth method. Frontend uses react-force-graph-2d for canvas-based graph rendering. Node clicks on canvas open detail sidebar. Importance controls only visible for topic nodes (not person nodes). Test file uses correct WebSocket connection pattern with 'connect' RPC for auth.

backend_rpc_methods.mindmap.get: Returns cached mindmap with nodes[], edges[], generated_at
backend_rpc_methods.mindmap.generate: Creates fresh mindmap using LLM from memories/people/conversations
backend_rpc_methods.mindmap.set_importance: Sets high/medium/low importance on topic nodes, validates params

frontend_components.sidebar_nav: Mindmap nav item with Network icon at /admin/mindmap
frontend_components.toolbar: Topic/people counts, generated timestamp, Regenerate button
frontend_components.legend: 7 category colors: work, personal, urgent, planning, communication, learning, person
frontend_components.graph_canvas: react-force-graph-2d with force-directed layout, topic/person nodes
frontend_components.node_detail_panel: Opens on node click, shows label, type badge, category, summary, importance controls

data_structure.nodes: id, label, type (topic/person), category, summary, importance, role, team
